title: Classic Recess Games
description: The school bell rang and recess began! How well do you remember the games that filled schoolyards across America?

questions.question: In the schoolyard game of Dodgeball, what was the main objective?
options: Hit opponents with the ball while avoiding being hit yourself
Catch the ball the most times

questions.question: What schoolyard game involved two teams lined up facing each other, with one team calling a player to 'come over'?
Tetherball involved hitting a ball attached by a rope to what?
In the game of Tag, what was the designated safe area where players couldn't be tagged called?
What schoolyard game was played with a large ball that was kicked instead of thrown?
In the game of Simon Says, when were players supposed to follow the command?
options: Only when the leader said 'Simon Says' first

questions.question: What recess game involved bouncing a ball against the school building wall while performing tasks?
Duck, Duck, Goose was a popular game for younger students. What did the 'Goose' have to do?
options: Chase the person who tagged them around the circle

questions.question: What was the name of the game where children lined up and passed a ball overhead and between legs alternately?
Tug of War required what piece of equipment?
What counting method did children commonly use to decide who would be 'It' in a game?
In the game of Chinese Jump Rope (elastics), where did players hook the elastic band?
options: Around the ankles of two holders

questions.question: What game involved a person hiding their eyes against a wall and counting while others ran to hide?
What schoolyard activity involved two players facing each other and clapping hands in rhythm while chanting?
What was the standard signal that recess was over and children had to return to class?
